BayesianNetwork - Class in bn.base
Base implementation of a BayesianNetwork as a graph of Nodes each of which corresponds to a RandomVariable with a CPT.
BayesianNetwork - Interface in bn.core
A BayesianNetwork is a directed acyclic graph where the nodes correspond to RandomVariables and store the conditional distribution of their variable given its parents.

Construct and return a new (empty) BayesianNetwork.

CPT - Class in bn.base
Base implementation of a conditional probability table (CPT) as a Map from Assignments to Distributions.
CPT - Interface in bn.core
A conditional probability table (CPT) for a RandomVariable in a BayesianNetwork gives a probability, for each Value in the variable's Range, for every possible assignment of Values to its parents.
CPT(RandomVariable) - Constructor for class bn.base.CPT
 
CPT.AssignmentMap - Class in bn.base

Distribution - Interface in bn.core
A Distribution for a RandomVariable is a probability for each of its Values such that the values satisfy the axioms of probability (are all between 0 and 1, inclusive, and sum to 1).

recursivelyInitCPT(CPT, Assignment, List<RandomVariable>, StringTokenizer) - Method in class bn.parser.XMLBIFParser
Recursively initialize the given CPT as follows: If the list of givens (parents) is empty: Then use the given ArrayMapAssignment (of values to parents) for the ``row'' of the CPT For each value of the CPT's variable, read a token, parse it as a double, and set that as the probability for the value in the row Note that this will handle the priors for variables with no parents since the first call to this method passes an empty ArrayMapAssignment. Otherwise: Remove the first variable from the list of givens (parents) For each value of that variable, add the variable=value assignment to the ArrayMapAssignment and recurse on the rest of the givens.
recursivelyPrintTable(BayesianNetwork, Assignment, RandomVariable, List<RandomVariable>) - Method in class bn.parser.XMLBIFPrinter
XMLBIF spec: ``The body of the TABLE tag is a sequence of non-negative real numbers, in the counting order of the declared variables, taking the GIVEN variables first and then the FOR variables.''
